checks.title: Synthetic Keys removed
checks.description: See https://help.qlik.com/en-US/sense/April2020/Subsystems/Hub/Content/Sense_Hub/Scripting/synthetic-keys.htm?tr=ru-RU for more information on Synthetic Keys.

checks.title: Circular references removed from the data model
checks.description: See https://help.qlik.com/en-US/sense/April2020/Subsystems/Hub/Content/Sense_Hub/LoadData/understand-circular-references.htm for more information on Circular references.

checks.title: Timestamps removed or decoupled from date field
checks.description:
To reduce unique records in a field, it is recommended to separate the timestamps from the date fields.
If there are no timestamps in the analysis, then you can get rid of them using the formula `Date(Floor(YourDateField))`.
If you want to keep the timestamps in the model, you can remove the time to store only the date in one field, and store the time in another field using the formula `Time(Frac(Timestamp#(YourDateField,'MM/DD/YYYY h:mm:ss TT ')))`.

checks.title: Data islands avoided
checks.description: Unlinked tables can be useful, but they can have a huge impact on the application performance. Try replacing islands with variables if you are using islands for the sample.

checks.title: Minimum number of AGGR function uses
Comparison of string values is avoided where possible
checks.description:
String comparison is not as efficient as set analysis.
Formulas: `Match()`, `MixMatch()`, `WildMatch`, `Pick`, etc.
Use them only when necessary, such as in a load script as part of a `WHERE` clause.
Avoid them in the frontend where possible and create flags in your data load script or use set analysis instead.

checks.title: Calculation conditions are used for visualization objects that display or process a large number of lines
checks.description:
Typically, Qlik Sense has visualizations that are able to display many records (such as tables).
To avoid the possibility of creating large hypercubes, it is recommended that you add calculation conditions to objects so that they only appear after certain selections have been made, thereby rendering less data.
An example of this would be using functions like `GetSelectedCount([Country]) = 1 OR GetPossibleCount([Country]) = 1`.
In this scenario, the user have to select one country when the visualization is available to the user.
